hints.content:
Each ![A cookie picture.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ffd7c5622c9bc75cdd526ae7465e37c22a21871e) equals $\blueD6$ cookies.



So, each ![A half cookie picture.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f5fa44481d6c1062e6c1952ab2dfab6778395aad) equals $\greenD3$ cookies.

Let's find out how many pictures are across from peanut butter and sugar.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of cookies and the vertical axis labeled Cookie Type. Each type of cookie is listed along the vertical axis from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Chocolate Chip, Sugar, Oatmeal, Peanut Butter, and Snickerdoodle. The amount of each type of cookie is represented by the number of cookie pictures plotted on the graph. Chocolate Chip is represented by 6 cookie pictures, Sugar is represented by 2 cookie pictures, Oatmeal is represented by 3 cookie pictures and 1 half cookie picture, Peanut Butter is represented 4 cookie pictures and 1 half cookie picture, and Snickerdoodle is represented by 4 cookie pictures. The Sugar cookie pictures are labeled 1 and 2. The Peanut Butter cookie pictures are labeled 1, 2, 3, 4, and one half. !

hints.content:
Cookie Type | Number of ![A cookie picture.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ffd7c5622c9bc75cdd526ae7465e37c22a21871e)| Number of cookies
:- | :-: | :-:
Peanut Butter | $4\dfrac12$ | $({4}\times\blueD{6}) + \greenD3=27$ cookies
Sugar | $2$ | ${2}\times\blueD{6}=12$ cookies
Peanut butter sold $15$ more cookies than sugar.

question.content:
Yoav graphed the  number of cookies sold at the bake sale. 

![A cookie picture.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ffd7c5622c9bc75cdd526ae7465e37c22a21871e) $=6$ cookies

[[☃ image 2]]

**Fill in the blank.**

Peanut butter sold [[☃ input-number 2]] more cookies than Sugar.

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of cookies and the vertical axis labeled Cookie Type. Each type of cookie is listed along the vertical axis from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Chocolate Chip, Sugar, Oatmeal, Peanut Butter, and Snickerdoodle. The amount of each type of cookie is represented by the number of cookie pictures plotted on the graph. Chocolate Chip is represented by 6 cookie pictures, Sugar is represented by 2 cookie pictures, Oatmeal is represented by 3 cookie pictures and 1 half cookie picture, Peanut Butter is represented 4 cookie pictures and 1 half cookie picture, and Snickerdoodle is represented by 4 cookie pictures. !
